sentences.en: " However, every fashionista worth her salt takes risks,'scott said , " which means the occasional misstep. "
sentences.cn: 不过, 任何一位时尚人士都要冒险, 也就是说 她们偶尔也会失误.

sentences.en: A misstep here could cost millions of dollars.
sentences.cn: 这里的一个失误可能会造成数百万美元的损失。

sentences.en: But by their misstep salvation has come to the Gentiles, to provoke them to jealousy.
sentences.cn: 反倒因他们的过失,救恩便临到外邦人, 好惹动他们妒忌.
迷惑造成他不幸的失足.

sentences.en: One misstep doesn't affect your career.
sentences.cn: 一次失误并不会影响你的职业生涯.

sentences.en: Professional choice is bad, be equal to is misstep circle.
sentences.cn: 专业选择错了, 等于就是踏错了圈子.

sentences.en: Success is often the result of taking a misstep in the right direction.
sentences.cn: 成功往往是因为在正确的方向上不小心走错了一步.

sentences.en: The slightest misstep or gust of wind could cause him to fall off the wire.
sentences.cn: 走错一小步或轻微的风就能把他吹下铁丝.

sentences.en: Thinking of Juno as just a teenage comedy would be a truly patronizing misstep.
sentences.cn: 如果你认为《朱诺》只是一部青少年喜剧的话,那可就大错特错了.

trans.tran_en: a mistake, especially one that is caused by not understanding a situation correctly
